subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one.
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_008B_01C861E7.1D2D0B10
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

That really is a sad thought, especially regarding kids.  What can we do?  =
I can't stand thinking of them being lost.  I joke sometimes about not know=
ing where to go when I die, but it's actually an intense fear of mine becau=
se my sense of direction is so terrible!

Robin


  ----- Original Message =
----- 
  From: Lisby<mailto:lisby@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Monday, January 28, 2008 5:35=
 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one.


  Wow. But good to k=
now that Hannah went on. I have to wonder if people follow their bodies to =
the graveyard and then don't know what the hell to do next. Especially kids=
. Examples of kid EVP in grave yards is so plentiful that it's heartbreakin=
g. Maybe they get there and others who are already hanging out there tell t=
hem its where they should stay, because they seem to have some kind of soci=
al life going on there, too. 



  One example that blew me away starts wit=
h a taper asking when anyone died. A male voice replies with a full date, s=
omething like, "September 5, 1952," then a long pause, "Do you think they h=
eard us?"


  Ann


  On Jan 28, 2008, at 8:26 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrot=
e:




    I always wonder what spirits are doing hanging around cemeteries=
 anyway.  You'd think they would gravitate somewhere more meaningful than w=
here their body was deposited, wouldn't you?  I haven't had much luck picki=
ng up graveyard EVP personally, but I do have one cool one.  I was standing=
 at the door of a mausoleum where a former governor and his wife are entomb=
ed, and I called the wife's name out loud while recording.  The response is=
 "Hannah isn't here!" 

    Robin


      ----- Original Message -----
    =
  From: Lisby<mailto:lisby@...>
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
      Sent: Monday, January 28, 2008 4:57 =
AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one.


      They might.=
 From what I have heard of other people's cemetery EVPs, it sounds like a l=
ot of cemeteries are populated with people who haven't made it over. I find=
 cemetery EVP to be the most fascinating because they seem to offer a glimp=
se into a chaotic and not-so-pretty part of the After Life that very few ar=
e willing to look at. Our cemeteries seem to me to truly be cities of the d=
ead.



      Ann


      On Jan 28, 2008, at 4:07 AM, Robin Searcy Henson =
wrote:




        I hear it all!  I'm envious of your location and all the=
 activity you're picking up.  Do you think some of these souls need help cr=
ossing over?

        Robin


          ----- Original Message -----
      =
    From: lisbyfarrum<mailto:lisby@...>
          To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
          Sent: Sunday, Januar=
y 27, 2008 5:19 PM
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one.


 =
         Gimme some opinions on this one, gang. The first part of the clip =
is
          the speed it can through at. The repeat is slowed by about 70 =
percent.
          I hear it as "Estep." I thought I had heard the word yes=
, so I ask,
          "Yes?" Under my voice is the name "Andrew," then "I'm=
 Stu." "Perfect."
          "No..??...asshole...fucking scared."

         =
 Do you hear this as I do? I'm postulating right now that because I
       =
   live immediately across the street from a cemetery, and in a
          1=
00-year-old sitting atop a 200+-year-old foundation and cellar, that
      =
    perhaps local dead folk who haven't crossed are popping in during
     =
     sessions. The voice that said "fucking scared" I swear I heard in
    =
      another file in my folder saying "scared people."

          Ann




=
